item.title: Christopher add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Let me be, was all I wanted. Be what I am, no matter how I am." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Billy Corgan
item.description: "That life can change, that we're not stuck in vain..." -- Billy Corgan

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Poetry is what happens when nothing else can." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Christopher add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Christopher add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Denis Waitley
item.description: "The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence." -- Denis Waitley

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "I love those who yearn for the impossible." -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "Death is the mother of beauty. Only the perishable can be beautiful, which is why we are unmoved by artificial flowers." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Christopher add a quote by William James
item.description: "The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude." -- William James

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee And I'll forgive Thy great big one on me." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Christopher add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Christopher add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and Iâ€” I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Christopher add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everybody says sex is obscene. The only true obscenity is war." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Christopher add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Christopher add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "If I had my way we'd sleep every night all wrapped around each other like hibernating rattlesnakes." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Christopher add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Silence is only frightening to people who are compulsively verbalizing." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Christopher add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Christopher add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "There is no intensity of love or feeling that does not involve the risk of crippling hurt. It is a duty to take this risk, to love and feel without defense or reserve." -- William S. Burroughs
